title: About
text:
The Plant Agriculture Field Trip course, which is better known around campus as the Midwest Tour, is a field study course designed to increase the student’s breadth of knowledge of agricultural production and agri-business in North America. Students in the course tour a selected area of the US Midwest Region prior to the fall semester, visiting cash crop and livestock farms, supporting industries (e.g. processing, manufacturing) and markets (e.g. elevators, stockyards)
If you came across this site by chance, you may be interested in checking out our roots at the University of Guelph, the Ontario Agriculture College and the Department of Plant Agriculture.


Instructors

Assistant Professor Adrian Correndo  Department of Plant Agriculture  University of Guelph 

Associate Professor Andy Robinson  Department of Animal Biosciences  University of Guelph

title: Logistics
text:
🛑 Rules📅 Timing🧳 Packing🦺 Safety🍽️ Meals🧾 Admin


These rules are in place to ensure a safe, respectful, and enjoyable experience for everyone. Please take them seriously.

📄 Documents: You are responsible for carrying a valid passport and, if required, a U.S. visa. These must be accessible during border crossing and remain with you throughout the tour.
🏥 Health Insurance: Guard.Me travel insurance is mandatory for all participants. It covers emergency evacuation, repatriation, third-party liability, and more. Sign up at: https://www.guard.me/guelphinternational
🚫 No alcohol on the bus. Any alcohol must be stowed in your suitcase below in the luggage compartment.
🚌 The bus is a traveling classroom — all University of Guelph policies apply.
🙏 Respect the bus, our hosts, hotel staff, and your fellow travelers.
⏰ Be early for all departure times. We will leave without you, and the driver will not stop.
👀 Look out for each other, especially in hotels and during your free time at night.
📝 Follow the Terms of Participation. Violations may result in removal from the tour at your own expense.
📅 Monitor Duties: Each student will be assigned a day/stop and will:

Arrive early to assist with bus loading and room key collection - Prepare discussion questions for site visits

Present thank-you gifts to hosts (U of G maple syrup or honey)

Help unload the bus and distribute room keys

Assist the driver in tidying the coach

Submit the group blog post for the day by the next morning


As participants, you are representing the University of Guelph — please act with professionalism, maturity, and respect throughout the trip.



Departure: Sunday, August 24 at 6:30 AM (Lang Way, between Crop Science & the Hockey Rink). Please arrive by 6:10 AM.
Return: Saturday, September 6 at approximately 2:30 PM.
Pitstops: ⏰ 30 minutes max; if everyone is back early, we leave early.
Lunch stops: ⏰ 1 hour max. Options vary—plan ahead.
Most pitstops will be at Walmarts, truck stops, or highway rest areas.




🎒 One suitcase (under bus) + one backpack (on bus)
Must bring:

💻 Laptop, field notebook, pens
🧢 Hat, 🧥 rain jacket, 🧶 sweater
👟 Comfortable shoes (+ sandals for evenings)
🩱 Bathing suit (some hotels have pools)
🧴 Sunscreen, 💤 pillow for the bus, 🎴 cards or 📚 reading material
📀 Optional: Movies for the bus (after 11:00 AM on long days — ask first)





👞 Closed-toed shoes required at:

Hammonds (Day 5)

Corteva Seedcorn Plant (Day 10)

Corteva HQ (Day 11)

GDM (Day 13)

👖 Long pants required: Corteva Seedcorn Plant (Day 10)




Lunch provided at: Foote Cattle (Day 7) and Corteva Headquarters (Day 11)
Most lunch stops have fast food nearby—but not all. Bring snacks or plan ahead.
Suggested dinner options will be listed for most hotel locations.




📧 Corteva HQ: You will receive email instructions to pre-register using your UoG email.

title: Logistics
text:
Departure: Sunday, August 24 at 6:30 AM (Lang Way, between Crop Science & the Hockey Rink). Please arrive by 6:10 AM.
Return: Saturday, September 6 at approximately 2:30 PM.
Pitstops: 30 minutes max; if everyone is back early, we leave early.
Lunch stops: 1 hour max. Options vary—plan ahead.
Most pitstops will be at Walmarts, truck stops, or highway rest areas.





👞 Closed-toed shoes required at:

Hammonds (Day 5)

Corteva Seedcorn Plant (Day 10)

Corteva HQ (Day 11)

GDM (Day 13)

👖 Long pants required: Corteva Seedcorn Plant (Day 10)





Lunch provided at: Foote Cattle (Day 7) and Corteva Headquarters (Day 11)
Most lunch stops have fast food nearby—but not all. Bring snacks or plan ahead.
Suggested dinner options will be listed for most hotel locations.





📧 Corteva HQ: You will receive email instructions to pre-register using your UoG email.





🎒 One suitcase (under bus) + one backpack (on bus)
Must bring:

💻 Laptop, field notebook, pens
🧢 Hat, 🧥 rain jacket, 🧶 sweater
👟 Comfortable shoes (+ sandals for evenings)
🩱 Bathing suit (some hotels have pools)
🧴 Sunscreen, 💤 pillow for the bus, 🎴 cards or 📚 reading material
📀 Optional: Movies for the bus (after 11:00 AM on long days — ask first)





Each student will be assigned to a day/stop. Monitors will:

Be on the bus early to help load and collect room keys

Prepare a set of questions for the day’s stops

Thank hosts (with UoG honey or maple syrup)

Help unload bus and distribute room keys

Assist the driver in tidying the bus

Submit the group’s blog entry by the next morning
